If your laptop was set up by UBC It, it is automatically encrypted. Backing up your files It is crucial that you install and set up a data backup software on your computer(s). There has been numerous hard drive failures in the lab before, and you should always be prepared that the hard drive in your computer can stop working at any moment. Nicholas will pay for SYNC (4TB) if desired and provide a portable hard drive for local backups. To automate backups you can use software like Cobian Backup. Schedule your backups to be incremental and run them daily. Setting up a shared drive IRSS has access to a file server, which is divided into two main folders. ByProject & ByUser ByProject contains datasets related to research projects; ByUser is a space for each lab member to share data with others. These two folders can be accessed from any computer in the lab and should be mapped for easier access. Its important that you do not use IRSS shared drives as your file backup folder as storage space on these drives is limited. To map these drives to your machine do the following: Open File Explorer > right-click on This PC (found in left side list) > click map network drive Choose a letter (e.g. Z) and paste the following \\FRST-IRSStor\Root\ByProject Repeat this process and assign a different letter (e.g. Y) to the second network folder: \\FRST-IRSStor\Root\ByUser
